tuv.seg: The District Court is the lowest court in the Irish court system
Tá an Chúirt Dúiche ar an gcúirt is ísle i gcóras cúirte na hÉireann
It is presided over by the President of the District Court and 63 District Court Judges
Tá Uachtarán na Cúirt Dúiche chomh maith le 63 Breitheamh den Chúirt Dúiche i gceannas uirthi
The District Court is organised on a regional basis
Tá an Chúirt Dúiche eagraithe ar bhonn réigiúnach
There are 23 District Court Districts, as well as the Dublin Metropolitan District
Tá 23 Dúiche sa Chúirt Dúiche, chomh maith le Dúiche Cheannchathartha Bhaile Átha Cliath
Each District is in turn divided into District Court areas
Tá gach Dúiche ansin roinnte i gceantair den Chúirt Dúiche
The District Court is a court of local and limited jurisdiction
Is cúirt áitiúil agus le húdarás srianta é an Chúirt Dúiche
This means it is restricted as to which cases it can decide in both civil and criminal matters
Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil sí srianta ó thaobh na gcásanna ar féidir léi cinneadh a dhéanamh i gcúinsí sibhialta agus coiriúla
Under Part 3 of the Courts and Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2013 the monetary jurisdiction of the District Court increased to €15,000 (was €6,348.69) with effect from 3 February 2014

Faoi Chuid 3 d'Acht na gCúirteanna agus an Dlí Sibhialta (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha) 2013 an dlínse airgeadaíochta na Cúirte Dúiche méadaithe go dtí €15,000 (ba é €6,348.69) le héifeacht ón 3 Feabhra 2014
A District Court cannot hear a case that has not been commenced in the correct District Court area
Ní féidir le Cúirt Dúiche éisteacht le cás nár thosaíodh sa cheantar den Chúirt Dúiche cirte
The case must be brought, heard and decided in the District Court area:
Ní mór an cás a thógáil, éisteacht leis agus cinneadh a dhéanamh air sa cheantar den Chúirt Dúiche:
• Where the defendant or one of the defendants ordinarily resides or carries on any profession, business or occupation
• Ina bhfuil gnáthchónaí ar an gcosantóir nó duine de na cosantóirí nó san áit ina bhfuil siad ag obair, ina bhfuil gnó nó fostaíocht acu
• If the plaintiff chooses,
• Má roghnaíonn an t-éilitheoir,
- in proceedings based on contract, where the contract was made
- i gcásanna bunaithe ar chonradh, san áit inar rinneadh an conradh
- in proceedings based on tort (e.g., personal injuries actions), where the tort is alleged to have been committed
- i gcásanna bunaithe ar thort (m.sh. cásanna gortaithe phearsanta), ina bhfuil sé líomhainte gur tharla an tort
- in proceedings to eject a person from lands or property, where the lands or property in question is located
- i gcásanna chun duine a íobairt ó thailte nó ó mhaoin, san áit ina bhfuil na tailte nó an mhaoin atá i gceist lonnaithe;
The District Court is restricted to hearing cases where the damages or compensation sought do not exceed a certain amount
Tá srian ar an gCúirt Dúiche maidir le héisteacht le cásanna ina dtéann na damáistí nó an cúiteamh atá á n-éileamh thar mhéid áirithe
The District Court can hear cases:
Is féidir leis an gCúirt Dúiche éisteacht le cásanna:
• In contract generally where the claim does not exceed €15,000
• I gconradh go ginearálta nuair nach dtéann an t-éileamh níos airde ná €15,000
• In actions founded on hire-purchase and credit-sale agreements where the hire-purchase price of the goods or the amount of the claim does not exceed €15,000
• I gcásanna bunaithe ar chomhaontuithe fruilcheannaigh agus díolacháin creidmheasa, nuair nach dtéann praghas ceannaigh na n-earraí nó méid an éilimh thar €15,000
• In tort, where the claim for compensation does not exceed €15,000
• I dtort, nuair nach dtéann an t-éileamh ar chúiteamh thar €15,000
• In ejectment for non-payment of rent or overholding of property, where the annual rent does not exceed €15,000 per annum
• In imeacht eisiachtana mar gheall ar neamh-íocaíocht de chíos nó maoin a róshealbhú, nuair nach dtéann an cíos bliantúil thar €15,000 in aghaidh na bliana
• In actions for wrongful detention of goods where the value of the goods claimed does not exceed €15,000
• I gcásanna de choinneáil éagórach d’earraí nuair nach dtéann luach na n-earraí éilithe thar €15,000
Other types of cases that the District Court may hear include:
D’fhéadfadh an Chúirt Dúiche éisteacht le cineálacha cásanna eile lena n-áirítear:
• Family cases where the District Court has the power to make maintenance, barring, custody, access and affiliation orders
• Cásanna teaghlaigh nuair atá an chumhacht ag an gCúirt Dúiche orduithe cothabhála, barrtha, coimeádta, rochtana agus comhcheangail a dhéanamh
• Enforcement of judgements, including the power to examine debtors as to their means, to order payment of the debt by instalments and to commit the debtor to prison for default in payment

• Feidhmiú breithiúnais, lena n-áirítear an chumhacht scrúdú a dhéanamh ar fhiachóirí maidir lena n-acmhainní, íocaíocht an fhéich a ordú trí dhíolaíochtaí agus an fiachóir a aithint do phríosún sa chás go dteipeann orthu íoc

• Licensing cases, e.g., the granting of certificates for intoxicating liquor licences, the granting of certificates for auctioneer's and the lottery licences, the granting of licences for public dancing, etc
• Cásanna ceadúnaithe, m.sh. teastais a bhronnadh do cheadúnais deochanna meisciúla, teastais a bhronnadh do cheadúnais ceantálaí agus crannchuir, ceadúnais a bhronnadh do damhsaí poiblí, srl
• Malicious damages cases where the amount claimed does not exceed €15,000
• Cásanna damáistí mailíseacha nuair nach dtéann an mhéid atá á éileamh thar €15,000
A criminal case will be heard in the District Court area where:
Éistfear le cás coiriúil sa cheantar den Chúirt Dúiche:
• The offence was committed or
• Inar rinneadh an choir nó
• The defendant resides or carries on business or
• Ina bhfuil cónaí ar an gcosantóir nó ina ndéanann sé/sí a g(h)nó nó
• The defendant was arrested
• Inar gabhadh an cosantóir
There are two types of criminal offences:
Tá dhá chineál choir choiriúla ann:
• Summary offences, i.e., offences that are tried by a judge sitting alone
• Coireanna achomair, m.sh. coireanna atá triailithe ag breitheamh atá ag suí leis/léi féin
• Indictable offences, i.e., offences that can be tried by a judge and jury
• Coireanna díotálacha, m.sh., coireanna a d'fhéadfadh a bheith triailithe ag breitheamh agus giúiré
The criminal jurisdiction of the District Court falls under the following headings
Tagann údarás cóiriúil den Chúirt Dúiche faoi na ceannteidil seo a leanas
Summary offences that may be heard by the District Court Judge sitting without a jury. This makes up the great bulk of the work of the District Court and these offences come from legislation only

Coireanna achomair a d'fhéadfadh a bheith eisithe ag Breitheamh den Chúirt Dúiche ag suí gan ghiúiré Déanann sé seo suas an-chuid den obair a dhéanann an Chúirt Dúiche agus tagann na coireanna seo ó reachtaíocht amháin
Indictable offences which are triable summarily on the basis that:
Coireanna díoltálacha gur féidir a thriail go hachomair chomh fada agus go bhfuil:
• In the view of the judge, the facts alleged constitute a minor offence and
• I dtuairim an bhreithimh, na fíricí líomhainte ina mionchoir agus
• The accused, on being informed of his/her right to be tried by a jury, does not object to being tried summarily and
• An duine atá cúisithe i gcoinne nó tar éis agóid a dhéanamh i gcoinne a bheith triailte go hachomair, agus é ráite leis/léi go bhfuil sé de cheart aige a bheith triailte ag giúiré
• In the case of certain offences, the Director of Public Prosecutions has consented to a summary trial
• I gcás coireanna áirithe, an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí tar éis triail achomair a cheadú
These types of offences are specified in the appropriate legislation
Tá na cineálacha coireanna seo sainithe sa reachtaíocht chuí
Indictable offences that may be dealt with summarily (not certain offences including rape, aggravated sexual assault, murder, treason and piracy) when:
Coireanna díoltálacha a d’fhéadfadh a bheith pléite go hachomair (ní coireanna áirithe lena n-áirítear éigniú, tromionsaí gnéasach, dúnmharú, tréas agus píoráideacht) nuair:
• The accused, when before the District Court, pleads guilty and
• A phléadálann an té atá cúisithe ciontach, agus iad os comhair na Cúirte Dúiche agus
• The judge is satisfied that the accused understands the charge and
• Atá an breitheamh sásta go dtuigeann an té atá cúisithe an chúis agus
• The Director of Public Prosecutions consents
• A cheadaíonn an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí
If the case is not dealt with by the District Court, the accused is sent forward to the Circuit Court for sentence
Mura bpléann an Chúirt Dúiche leis an gcás, cuirtear an té atá cúisithe ar aghaidh go dtí an Chúirt Chuarda le haghaidh pianbhreithe
At the Circuit Court, he/she may withdraw his/her plea of "guilty" and alter it to "not guilty", in which case a trial takes place
Ag an gCúirt Charda, d’fhéadfadh sé/sí a p(h)léadáil de ‘ciontach’ a aistarraingt agus é a athrú go ‘neamhchiontach’ agus sa chás sin tarlaíonn triail
Indictable offences not triable summarily, that is, cases that must be heard by a judge and jury
Coireanna díoltálacha nach féidir a thriail go hachomair, is é sin, cásanna a chaithfidh breitheamh agus giúiré éisteacht leo
In these cases, the accused is served with a "Book of Evidence", i.e., a statement of the charge and of the evidence intended to be introduced to the court and a list of witnesses and exhibits

Sna cásanna seo, tá “Leabhar Fianaise” curtha os comhair an té atá cúisithe, m.sh., ráiteas den chúis agus den fhianaise a bheidh curtha i láthair os comhair na cúirte chomh maith le liosta finnéithe agus taispeántán
The Disrtict Court Judge no longer considers the material and submissions, on behalf of the accused or the prosecution, to decide whether there is a sufficient case
Ní dhéanann an breitheamh den Chúirt Dúiche machnamh ar an ábhar nó ar na haighneachtaí níos mó, ar son an té atá cúisithe nó an ionchúisimh, d’fhonn cinneadh a dhéanamh an bhfuil leorchás ann
This was the process known as preliminary examination and has been abolished
Ba phróiseas é seo ar a tugadh réamhscrúdú agus fuarthas réidh leis

The District Court Judge will send the accused forward to the Circuit Court or Central Criminal Court for trial once the book of evidence has been served and the DPP has consented to sending the case forward

Seolfaidh an breitheamh den Chúirt Dúiche an té atá cúisithe ar aghaidh chuig an gCúirt Chuarda nó an bPríomh-Chúirt Choiriúil don triail tar éis don Leabhar Fianaise a bheith seirbheáilte agus gur cheadaigh an DPP an cás a sheoladh ar aghaidh
